text: Original Doberman is the second studio album released by Jamaican singer Shaggy. Released on July 1, 1994, the album has become Shaggy's only album not to have any singles released from it. The album features several duets with Rayvon, some of which were included on Rayvon's greatest hits compilation, which was released in 2003. "Lately" was used as the theme to popular Jamaican game show Lamba between 1994 and 1995. The album was re-issued in 2002 with the same track listing. ==Track listing== # "Kibbles and Bits" – 3:51 # "Bullet-Proof Buddy" – 3:28 # "We Never Danced to the Rub-a-Dub Sound" – 3:27 # "Alimony" – 3:52 # "Jump and Rock" – 3:43 # "Chow" – 3:42 # "P.H.A.T." – 3:49 # "Wildfire" – 3:54 # "Glamity Power" – 3:40 # "Man a Yard" – 3:21 # "Get Down to It" – 3:39 # "Soldering" – 3:36 # "Lately" – 3:53 (Stevie Wonder cover) ==References== Category:1994 albums Category:Shaggy (musician) albums
title: Original Doberman
